intro: Cabralea laevis, commonly known as the smooth cabralea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
